result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashanti Malachi Coates

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.   

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case dismissed but read-in to 15CM481 for purposes of sentencing.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Arguments heard as to maximum time.  Court finds that the 12 month maximum period will apply.  Amended Order filed. Case remains scheduled for return on doctor's report on 11-30-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Case scheduled for return on doctor's report with 15CM481.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Decision scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM MENDOTA FOR PURPOSES OF THE RETURN ON DOCTOR'S REPORT IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report by Dr. Andrea Mc Glynn received and filed with court.
Report from Dr. Adrea McGlynn received and filed with court.

Status conference scheduled for 09-30-2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the doctor's report date if still in custody.
Return on doctor's report scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Statements to the Court by the parties and the defendant.
Court finds that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Defendant to be returned to Mendota for continued treatment.  Court orders case adjourned for updated doctor's report in Branch 45 and a status prior to that date-in the event doctor's report is not yet submitted to the Court, the order to produce will be canceled on the status date.
Defendant to be returned/transported FORTHWITH.

Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for Hearing/Doctor's Report Return.  Defendant has not yet been transported to Mendota.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Forensic tracking report, received and filed.
Forensic Tracking Report, received and filed.

Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Pankiewicz's report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Pankiewicz's report.  Court qualified Dr. Pankiewicz to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Pankiewicz.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report, and testimony of Dr. Pankiewicz, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility. The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 46.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of report dated 04-15-2015 authored by Dr. Pankiewicz.  Defense challenging findings of the report.  Hearing date selected with the parties. Wisconsin Forensic Unit notified.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Ashanti Malachi Coates in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
